content.title: 2019 Non-Profit Developer Summit - Oakland - Nov 6-8th
content.description:
Since 2002 there's been a conference which was about connecting people at the intersection of technology and social change. It's a facilitated and structured event around sharing, connecting, and learning from each other. Nobody gets up on stage, no panels, and no talks. It strives to be inclusive and driven by a collective desire to make the world a better place, building the tools for people organizing to change the world. 

The name's actually changed over the years, originally it was [Tech ToolBox Action Camp](http://neural.it/2002/07/tech-toolbox-action-camp-seminars-on-the-internet-for-activists/), then it became [Advocacy Dev Summit](https://aspirationtech.org/events/AdvocacyDevI), and eventually the name settled on [Nonprofit Software Development Summit](https://aspirationtech.org/events/devsummit19).

We had a few great sessions on scuttlebutt there last year, and look forward to more this year. This event is our people, and if any of you are around, or able to make it i highly recommend attending. 

------

Our 16th annual Nonprofit Software Development Summit will be held 6-8 November, 2019, at Preservation Park, Oakland.

Our collaborative three-day gathering is designed for everyone from grassroots activists to software developers, bringing together participants from around the world to share knowledge, build relationships, and collectively envision the future of free and open technology to support social change.

#### What makes the Dev Summit different?
Technology plays an ever-increasing role in all aspects of activism and social change efforts, but too often tech is hyped as a catch-all solution or a magic ingredient when in fact the reality is more complex. Technology can be a tremendous asset in organizing, campaigning, mobilization, and other efforts, but it also creates new vulnerabilities and often perpetuates power dynamics that run counter to the values of those using the tech. And increased dependence on tech correlates with increased vulnerability to surveillance and tracking.

Dev Summit is a tech-themed event that centers on people and focuses less on tech and more on movement strategy and building collective power. The Dev Summit community has been coming together for the better part of 2 decades to discuss how tech can accountably and sustainably serve social and racial justice efforts. New folks are always welcome, and our goal is to empower those who are early in their learning journeys and who don't necessarily self-identify as "techies".

The Dev Summit strives to avoid hyping and fetishizing tech, and instead focuses on conveying practical and essential processes for utilizing digital tools in sustainable ways. The event is designed to provide participants with best practices and insights they can apply in their day-to-day work. Conversation address the challenges, trade-offs, and opportunities we individually and collectively face in leveraging technology in our social justice and community work.

You will not see any presentations, panels or keynotes at the Dev Summit. The focus is on participant-driven dialogue and collaboration, and a primary objective is to enable participants to build and strengthen relationships where they can share knowledge and find support for many years to come.

#### Help us co-create the agenda

The Dev Summit agenda is a diverse collection of discussions and interactive sessions that are developed in collaboration with confirmed participants. We employ an [interactive and participatory approach to convenings](https://aspirationtech.org/events), and work to specifically address the outcomes that will be most useful and relevant to everyone who attends.

#### [Check out the conversations and discussions you are likely to find taking place at the Dev Summit.](https://aspirationtech.org/events/devsummit19/sessions)

You can also check out the [2018 agenda and session notes](https://devsummit.aspirationtech.org/index.php?title=2018_Agenda) which were co-created with participants.

We invite you to bring your stories, ideas, questions, and knowledge to share. If there is a session or discussion you would like to help facilitate or if you have an idea for the agenda, [let us know](mailto:devsummit19@aspirationtech.org).

content.text:
This morning outside the Supreme Court

![planetary attachment no.1](&63DhLERDiR68OgAdYXScMAgt+p5ROQDnqZH1L0MbAHI=.sha256)

RIP #RBG

![planetary attachment no.1](&mDeK92rmKZCu4rWZSdaCGPCWd6vXuwySYauKndmIUWs=.sha256)
![planetary attachment no.2](&8swkxvqAOV3pcmZauRgnqea2oxlLy7JnHEH1s1TXkFY=.sha256)

A few shots from an #ExtinctionRebellion action outside of #CNN in Washington, DC

![planetary attachment no.1](&djmiEjTguEkl+PbVCNuYKSl4q4JNV4ohIq001vmAmxk=.sha256)
![planetary attachment no.2](&kt9h87St6zWmtnoANFnrtvezgOT2kQQfJy6IyCnd70M=.sha256)
![planetary attachment no.3](&51Kvk2XU2TP/c2C2IJ6POe9EjJPon53egTfv9UbhlXA=.sha256)
![planetary attachment no.4](&HewPP4CbcdcwLe3107zR53PSngBilRsob93LwStblpI=.sha256)
![planetary attachment no.5](&zMZ2KzhTQT2S35gILgJZHyOesRsgegZoBBimT3nY42c=.sha256)
![planetary attachment no.6](&KM8apgxrk5s5+uQlEDh1ynp9HRe/r0+hbMe5B4MK+4c=.sha256)
![planetary attachment no.7](&tZiiVfvm3g7BcRbaD8zZvNgC6YHLtp7OaeQ1mnuDquQ=.sha256)
![planetary attachment no.8](&hiACB8zNEX50o97MqpCxONSrJROpDzVVDx2h11Ns/eU=.sha256)

Still struggling with using and managing artificial light. But I liked this. 



![planetary attachment no.1](&4EZJhqFfRx8ddsM2Y43iUo3BPA14vaIl97wNf+MHdN4=.sha256)
Going to take off from work and try to photograph the XR DC die-in at CNN tomorrow am.

This kid made it through one orbit. A hell of a ride.

![planetary attachment no.1](&AUIcXPV+8aldlSTluk9kho1iboL4T8cHfOUHA3gcRk4=.sha256)

Power outage. Not just a metaphor.

![planetary attachment no.1](&pqJiL7uVABk8g8Q1gcrm7i2Xrc9MEiURTOcdBNd5xeY=.sha256)

I’ve walked the full length of the corniche of two cities. San Francisco and #Beirut. I’ve got no business there, no real connections there, but a lot of love for Beirut. Always feeling for that city, but extra hard right now.
![planetary attachment no.1](&dfFy3E1VWw4QbpwQa4cLSgaujsnT3ulUvCUcPdG2JV0=.sha256)

._.

![planetary attachment no.1](&itmwpasFkkVwqF9nVhPppLej/MRuYRT/IMyPsOkVErA=.sha256)

Back in the woods. Busier than ever but try to be grateful for and use the means I have to get a taste despite the stupid times.

![planetary attachment no.1](&NiOlCylE+dIvqbd+EMKaVkULQVWDgln4e9sGtcepydU=.sha256)

Got into the woods beyond The Bubble for a few days. Stood in a creek with a cold beer. This is what I grew up with. I gave it up too fast.

![planetary attachment no.1](&YQpJbUFK6u6JMjjoDZhba9lj2cPLWBdpRCgS+JOz/VM=.sha256)

Almost feels “normal.” 

![planetary attachment no.1](&cCw3m13/dKXUViiH67f9lqSSOGrcVxFPH/e49jBBRjY=.sha256)

A moment before a video conference with old friends. Not unusual in these times, but precious nonetheless.

![planetary attachment no.1](&H2/8Bt5NV6ZLggWLJRPRXmAH9aGrOhYaUQSRCoq4aMs=.sha256)

Cue the James Bond theme.

![planetary attachment no.1](&Siuv9I6rUrpXrZ0bqE3bZ1fXGRV3J3Nc60wDkYVyt0k=.sha256)

Been hanging back from the action, keeping my nose to the grindstone, been getting permission to actually be a product manager - gonna get what I helped build over the past 6-7 years on a better track with our new resources and newly available executive support... and then: what next?

Trouble.

![planetary attachment no.1](&+4N8ihBWvJheXmKVw2SKwSX4ySB4GmFDcjy2QCHq0Ho=.sha256)

Mother’s Day was nice.

![planetary attachment no.1](&/nPUl+RtEWMzoGgrQ/ZIjbrnLYi/X+UpZf8/8/8/gaI=.sha256)
Having an inexplicably triggered nostalgic moment for the Musashi email client for Mac OS (pre-OS X).

Back! 

New release even snappier. 

(I was, for a while, on the last release and initially with the new release, getting stuck on launch. Retrying, canceling, truly quitting/launching again, and rebooting iOS was not enough. Deleted app and installed fresh. Obviously moot now.) 

![planetary attachment no.1](&GnaGVE8yJAjFqew+8A/5COuBubyN2ZgMLxza5BRzrYg=.sha256)
Lazy Sunday. No parenting points today. Sprawled on the floor and couch, kiddo watching Bosch with us.

Feeling snappier at the moment. Both from another nice walk in great weather and a fresh install of Planetary.  🌎🌏🌍

Considering a drive. An unnecessary drive. With the windows rolled down.
Looks nice — I think it’d help me discover more of interest.
I can’t figure out when my portrait mode shots are going to get clipped to squares and when they’ll expand from a square preview to a full size.

Tooling around the block.

![planetary attachment no.1](&rqOkLcJ5pRAtE7XTV2LuRQgCiXwU4B8c6YMezPuadg0=.sha256)

Well, I’ve helped hire a new boss for myself again.

Next time I should apply. ;-)

I’m over this.

Not wing-nut denialist over this.

But, over this.

Over how poorly it is handled, how poor infrastructure and information is, how poor the vision of leaders and “viable” vying leaders is for what the future needs to be.

Fucking over it.

Over how all that feels on top of being cooped-up in a smaller world with no childcare and few overtly safe places to really take my child.

🤷🏻‍♂️🤴

Oof. Weird autocorrect.

Will welcome the ability to edit posts. Not going to bother to delete and repost. 

How the eff iOS thought “a king” was worth inserting, I don’t know.

Another week and ... another week.

I am slowly accelerating a king running intentional purge: more out than coming in, hoping to attain a different balance eventually (with less to throw away, or otherwise get rid enough, except for say kid’s stuff that has usefulness and can find a new hands that need it).

Do need to get the spouse in sync with this program... and it is hard to be a new parent, especially in Quaran-time, without boxes arriving seemingly constantly.

Got my first couple of hours to myself in what seems like forever. Went over to Heritage and Kingman Islands in the Anacostia, near RFK Stadium.

Had to dodge people (more than I’d like, but not too many really, we all had the same idea and we’re mostly respectful).

![planetary attachment no.1](&lkUaEvq1q/BOaiWqORClq9w0Olrc4EbR66xWM+FZII8=.sha256)
![planetary attachment no.2](&uOZpDaU+uujWKkO2XAoTkW7ySqcZiuO0EWz3jBDVgQQ=.sha256)

This is about as close to the Easter Bunny as you’re going to get, kid. #coronavirus #covid-19

![planetary attachment no.1](&L1L0H0IkvPGmDfOB3hgFcBEDyizFpY3GR/znHZPzg28=.sha256)

I know one of the guys working on beneficial ownership. There’s a total cost of ownership too... (e.g. accounting for externalities costs, corporate welfare, environmental impact): whose working on that? Particularly the environmental angle? Don’t we deserve to know all forms of welfare? And if they’re for things we want to fare well? 

I want to work on that. Not sure how.

What’s the compelling, actionable story for preserving some of the brief breath some of the Earth has gotten from our pandemic lockdowns? How can we demand we don’t go back to normal? 

How do we convince the powerful and our fellow humans that we can “come back” from this and actually go forward, with a more meaningful step toward sustainability than most politico’s proposed plans?
We have forgone Tiger King in favor of re-watching Bosch. I’m also appreciating The Plot Against America.

I continue to test [Planetary](@oeNoy1RIArVdMdk8ndeoKbAKuU8b56VgxlYP5y8b9Ic=.ed25519), and Guy tests the new teething feature in this week’s watchOS 6.2.5 developer beta. 

![planetary attachment no.1](&EPhNAGIn+6rCItVdTNimhOmqQdXGEeaiGxm63iYHc8w=.sha256)
😷 💪🏴(Re: off-planetary thread — now I see this!)

There is no news from this corner of the global quarantines. Which is good news. Just being a good boy, and now with a bandana at the ready again. 

I remember when they tried to outlaw wearing those over the face in D.C. Now it’s good manners!
As ever, remaining socially distant despite social media.
Hey, this thing IS on!
Hello, dystopia
Wanted to delete and repost (autocorrect typo) and no-go.

We barely had winter, warmest ever, but chilly sometimes. 

People are testing this march and it’s warming up as normal. Our daily highs are 10-20F above average. 

#DC #climatecrisis

Trying to zap my brain with some TV. Maron’s End Times special maybe not great choice. Tom Papa’s farcical nostalgia wrapped around his WASPY fatherhood was a more relatable and tamer vector tonight, I guess.
Really.
Broadcasting from the center of the empire, which is finally facing up to SARS-CoV-2/COVID-19. 🤞🏻
Hello, World!

Squaring up to the investigable ‘No Filter’ - a totally instagrammable story by Sarah Frier. From ‘Normal’ to ‘X-Pro II’ to ‘Rise’ to my personal favourite, ‘Lo-Fi’. The transformation from ‘Burbn’ to ‘Scotch’ bypassing ‘Whsky’ to ‘Codename’ and finally to Instagram, thereby combining the words instant and telegram. Here’s that multi billion dollar Kevin Systrom and Mike Krieger  journey.

Soon after, Mozilla and Creative Commons announced their support. And now, we've opened up the first (of many) call-for-proposals. https://www.grantfortheweb.org/post/announcing-first-public-call-for-proposals

### Letter from the Author/Editor
Been thinking about this newsletter thing. Thought for a little bit about making a third account to follow everyone who could post something newsworthy. I've decided that this newsletter is not going to try to sum up the entire scuttleverse. This is heavily biased by my personal views and the people I choose to follow, and I'm okay with that. If you think I should put stuff in that I don't or vice versa, talk to me! If I don't change my mind, start your own post summary. I would love to see more of these reflecting other people's personal choices in what qualifies as newsworthy.
These have been late lately, I've been busy with school. It happens. I'm going to try not to miss a week completely because I know I would never start up again.

Happy October! Special section under art for inktober. I've heard the dude is trying to be a jerk about copyright and stuff but he can't catch me on here, so I will be calling it inktober as a catch-all for October month-long drawing challenges. Related, this is the first issue to have one of my posts in it! I debated myself on putting it in but I figured since I put every other inktober in I should put mine too.
This one is a little late since I've been super busy all of a sudden with school. Sorry in advance if I missed something news-worthy - I put together most of this in the past hour. Still found time tho! See y'all next week :)

### Current Events
Threads linked in this section may contain upsetting or serious content. Use your best judgment. If you're having a rough day, you can always wait to click until tomorrow.

### Letter from the Author/Editor
One month already! I've taken to excluding usernames from Current Events and SSB Community and Meta. No particular reason, it just seems right to me. Let me know if you have a reaction one way or the other. Not much else to say this week, I'll see you all next week!

## SSB Post Summary
Welcome to the fourth edition of SSB Post Summary! Expect these to be roughly every seven days, but not necessarily always on Thursday. To submit a post to the newsletter, dm this account, @ it, or use the #this hashtag.

A few reminders:
- I use the pronouns in profile descriptions, otherwise they/them. If I use the wrong pronouns, let me know! I'll update it in future issues and issue a correction statement if you want.
- I have read all posts linked here, but not necessarily their parent threads or links within posts, so click at your own risk.

### Art
Sept 24: [@Kira](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) has some [nature photography](%0USrkXDz+J6LT15wYzxgNTyA2YuB23muEDEJ3qts75E=.sha256)

### Food and Gardening

Sept 22: [@juul](@22YV3HX/BGClXH49ZebkcepqRpj7a9f5s0ddwhDSfxk=.ed25519) is doing [FTIR spectometry](%g0x3hYprx592b9qQCiVg+JrWXg/aSNvy4HChS68nfUw=.sha256)

Sept 23: [@emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519) is talking about [multicast](%hRQ39icrKmnUTeHSpie0CfstG+9oVLUaPJKizfkkCBA=.sha256)

### Current Events
Threads linked in this section may contain upsetting or serious content. Use your best judgment. If you're having a rough day, you can always wait to click until tomorrow.

[Personal perspective](%YLso8/Hn0i5B1xrxLSfq/EmavwdCFc5Qr161zRMfad0=.sha256) from a parent of a school-aged child during COVID

Discussion continues on the thread about [Mountain Equipment Coop being sold](%y7yoXp1jFh0QhiyWrEAVPyDcKdAAndw+AtBxGuEa1zQ=.sha256)

Experience and data as a [contact tracer](%YsMW/fGL+7WLpQydXKhBuJCaOywvfA1fq2YEb1B+MQ0=.sha256) for COVID-19

Documentation of [Hurricane Teddy's path](%Zpx5URiNynRArI25H4GNy2CNoVygPcVGbakxh7GXY7Y=.sha256)

Pictures from an [Extinction Rebellion event](%sihhrpHLW88QqsIQMKQG6nKSftMrmmY3RjN4P92+5KI=.sha256) in Copenhagen (cw in the thread for images of police)

### SSB Community and Meta
Sept 17: [@KawaiiPunk](@LVL4qjvmws3Cxavfi4iCQI6dSOqWqOyq5/5CHImILA8=.ed25519) started a discussion on [SSB funding and Oasis](%9NXKauuXCgJCHUaIXFGbpnXucAmvZ0QyQFJOAzURspc=.sha256)

Sept 18: [@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) explained the current [financial state](%EFwRD6lMHQ4m3WluZ8CfwdjfGdgyRmbvQZyX6iGJ4as=.sha256) of SSB

### Letter from the Author/Editor
I'm noticing it's hard to fit posts into nice week-shaped boxes due to ssb being a long-term type of platform. You'll see this week, and in the future, a lot of "Discussion continues..." type posts. I figure as long as there's still new info being added, it's worth another click. And typically you'll be able to tell it's a repeat link by the "Discussion continues", if you don't want to see it again. This week's summary is about an hour late, oops. I was playing Fall Guys to win a skin that looked like Godzilla for [@zaz](@v93CLJG6v9Y8A5yCKrFYfgc03FyqiN0wFN5cCX7jiV0=.ed25519). Hope everyone is doing well, and I'll see you all next week :)

### Letter from the Author/Editor
Thanks for reading the first issue, everyone! Feel free to talk to me about it in the comments, DMs, or even by DMing my main account, [@romeo](@LrIL+UAvV+msJFiCxKZMJHCDASB8ekaSefbH8qdEwKI=.ed25519). If you want to help contribute, let me know! If you really want something in here but it doesn't fit under the general guidelines, I'll make a section like "Community Submissions" or similar. So don't be shy! On a more personal note, I've found the biggest challenge so far is trying to actually read what I scroll through instead of only skimming to see if it would belong in the SPS (Scuttlebutt Post Summary). It definitely takes a level of mindfulness to consume the content and make that decision simultaneously. Despite that, I think I'm doing well! If the community got huge I would need help with running SPS, but at its current size and with what I can see of it, it takes about a half hour in the morning and evening to catch up and write entries for posts I want to include. And for me, that's manageable! Thanks again for reading, everyone, and if you don't leave feedback, I'll see you in about a week!

## SSB Post Summary 1 (Sept 3 - 9)
Welcome to the first edition of SSB Post Summary! Expect these to be roughly every seven days, but not necessarily always on Thursday. To submit a post to the newsletter, dm this account, @ it, or use the #this hashtag.

Some general guidelines:  
Posts shared here will be original, community-made content. Images will be linked but not embedded to keep the newsletter easily scrollable. I use the pronouns in profile descriptions, otherwise they/them. If I use the wrong pronouns, let me know! I'll update it in future issues and issue a correction statement if you want.

I have read all posts linked here, but not necessarily their parent threads or links within posts, so click at your own risk.

### Letter from the Author/Editor
Been thinking about this newsletter thing. Thought for a little bit about making a third account to follow everyone who could post something newsworthy. I've decided that this newsletter is not going to try to sum up the entire scuttleverse. This is heavily biased by my personal views and the people I choose to follow, and I'm okay with that. If you think I should put stuff in that I don't or vice versa, talk to me! If I don't change my mind, start your own post summary. I would love to see more of these reflecting other people's personal choices in what qualifies as newsworthy.
These have been late lately, I've been busy with school. It happens. I'm going to try not to miss a week completely because I know I would never start up again.

Happy October! Special section under art for inktober. I've heard the dude is trying to be a jerk about copyright and stuff but he can't catch me on here, so I will be calling it inktober as a catch-all for October month-long drawing challenges. ## SSB Post Summary
Welcome to the fifth edition of SSB Post Summary! Expect these to be roughly every seven days, but not necessarily always on Thursday. To submit a post to the newsletter, dm this account, @ it, or use the #this hashtag.

A few reminders:
- I use the pronouns in profile descriptions, otherwise they/them. If I use the wrong pronouns, let me know! I'll update it in future issues and issue a correction statement if you want.
- I have read all posts linked here, but not necessarily their parent threads or links within posts, so click at your own risk.

### Art
Oct 2: [@gwil](@PEqxT8YRvrkf2fyjAgTl8pmdo8aR4KVsKLyh0b5JyOE=.ed25519) took a [panorama](%+Le41lUf96SOzgFBQUCY7UJH74IVWiTDkpiBgafQIig=.sha256) of the beach

Oct 3: [@crowsnest](@sYXOD+IrwXf52z2AE6+ZynR1vLEX4t9uuC1xlCp4Ok4=.ed25519) wrote a [song](%nt9D3h2YUrtBb3lMS4zHrd1cdyftn4VrGWsspEggOkE=.sha256)

Oct 3: [@Shortwave](@F42GikZadGaS9vy3kFnDmQHeRlbOGxm9FlYcPorYVLc=.ed25519) has a [picture](%n2pBl4uq0mLAa29zkroTs5PMj2rseN1VfZvoZgLAoxY=.sha256) from 2011 in Singapore

Oct 4: [@KawaiiPunk](@LVL4qjvmws3Cxavfi4iCQI6dSOqWqOyq5/5CHImILA8=.ed25519) updated their [music website](%Dy/YtDbkBeA4ZaUzVQ2hUM8WN7vKoFPxwrKq5y+lOZs=.sha256)

Oct 5: [@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) made a [song](%DBxZq2Rwi9R7iQ5Z202xpURC08E5AIEsSoRGY4KaLeA=.sha256)

Oct 7: [@crowsnest](%KF+Ld9DkQQLtw1y/9oRvgVz+7NiNus1It8flsIFGv88=.sha256) drew ["Maniacal Laughter"](%KF+Ld9DkQQLtw1y/9oRvgVz+7NiNus1It8flsIFGv88=.sha256)

### Tech and Science
Sept 23-?: [@emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519)'s [multicast thread](%hRQ39icrKmnUTeHSpie0CfstG+9oVLUaPJKizfkkCBA=.sha256) continues

Sept 24: [@andrestaltz](@QlCTpvY7p9ty2yOFrv1WU1AE88aoQc4Y7wYal7PFc+w=.ed25519) announced [SSB Neon](%ce80ayDLE4rDCdVHER8KzAEC3QoQZApUoGho9uAY69o=.sha256) as a tool to move SSB more towards Rust

Sept 25: [@Rabble](@0uOwBrHIeiRK7lcvpLwjSFkcS3UHSQb/jyN52zf+J6Y=.ed25519) has a [post about decentralization and the web](%IEclK6Bk5dPEDO6EWJ7fqK+h+2Y3cRTzt4lFGjwdO7U=.sha256)

Sept 25: [@Luandro](@2RNGJafZtMHzd76gyvqH6EJiK7kBnXeak5mBWzoO/iU=.ed25519) has an [update on their mesh network](%y3DNL1+lleQlVQPIzgl2wNiiW/sQm9S8rO2YhMefxcM=.sha256)

Sept 25: [@dinoworm](@6ilZq3kN0F+dXFHAPjAwMm87JEb/VdB+LC9eIMW3sa0=.ed25519) made a [gridkit website](%x8xsRDDcbGp4a0H14Om0amiC0BMNAHKFeYQXRwaGDA8=.sha256)

Sept 25: [@Cory McWilliams](@+qiZPoR4Icyyhq9oceFLxy7lW5XBY9531OIMXh8LC2E=.ed25519) has an [update on Tilde Friends](%6P7jYpX7uA9szQybJEYMe68aM7d0hWNuhY/xXEl+AMI=.sha256)

Sept 28: [@mixmix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) introduced a [timeline view for Ahau](%+afGRsIjLmhaF/GVoTYOKRT1k/Q6MNhdjsqiL75L4jE=.sha256)

Sept 29: [@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) wrote a [book about roguelike development with JavaScript](%aIstrkPpOlZ8isJHDfVgr9zwVR8tpkepDDsfxEhYu4w=.sha256)

### Current Events
Threads linked in this section may contain upsetting or serious content. Use your best judgment. If you're having a rough day, you can always wait to click until tomorrow.

Personal experience with a [BLM protest](%vwiZn9sWyfebuAbvDZXdO8zT/UpIws7ZuFwrVHeKSC8=.sha256) (post is pro-BLM, but does discuss police violence. Click with caution)
COVID [news from Brazil](%jyVZYuPmBv0E2TcIhxJbJfaRA6V8OTCZytoTaJ9AaDQ=.sha256)

Portland is an [anarchistic jurisdiction](%a2y/sr6ZFYkVV102OoJAeV8hDTFMjrzUHk7H+h2zFhg=.sha256) now (cw for mentions of police and right-wing violence)

Update on [COVID-19 contact tracing](%FZXPLbJ5/TC+XVxz9sz5bRV8SX6JQir3q+JZxF06/Gg=.sha256)

### SSB Community and Meta
Sept 17-?: Discussion continues on SSB funding on [this thread](%9NXKauuXCgJCHUaIXFGbpnXucAmvZ0QyQFJOAzURspc=.sha256) including an [update](%a3bC5UNpZJppMKS7lUUlIM/0oPdvyj8w8HiLjWekuOQ=.sha256)

Sept 27: Talking about [SSB timestamps](%2AgShXDO00eHm/GDim6duUFTeBowg4r1oKxLfspCvrU=.sha256)

### Letter from the Author/Editor
One month already! I've taken to excluding usernames from Current Events and SSB Community and Meta. No particular reason, it just seems right to me. Let me know if you have a reaction one way or the other. Not much else to say this week, I'll see you all next week!

## SSB Post Summary
Welcome to the fourth edition of SSB Post Summary! Expect these to be roughly every seven days, but not necessarily always on Thursday. To submit a post to the newsletter, dm this account, @ it, or use the #this hashtag.

A few reminders:
- I use the pronouns in profile descriptions, otherwise they/them. If I use the wrong pronouns, let me know! I'll update it in future issues and issue a correction statement if you want.

### Current Events
Threads linked in this section may contain upsetting or serious content. Use your best judgment. If you're having a rough day, you can always wait to click until tomorrow.

[Personal perspective](%YLso8/Hn0i5B1xrxLSfq/EmavwdCFc5Qr161zRMfad0=.sha256) from a parent of a school-aged child during COVID

Discussion continues on the thread about [Mountain Equipment Coop being sold](%y7yoXp1jFh0QhiyWrEAVPyDcKdAAndw+AtBxGuEa1zQ=.sha256)

Experience and data as a [contact tracer](%YsMW/fGL+7WLpQydXKhBuJCaOywvfA1fq2YEb1B+MQ0=.sha256) for COVID-19

### SSB Community and Meta
Sept 17: [@KawaiiPunk](@LVL4qjvmws3Cxavfi4iCQI6dSOqWqOyq5/5CHImILA8=.ed25519) started a discussion on [SSB funding and Oasis](%9NXKauuXCgJCHUaIXFGbpnXucAmvZ0QyQFJOAzURspc=.sha256)

### Letter from the Author/Editor
I'm noticing it's hard to fit posts into nice week-shaped boxes due to ssb being a long-term type of platform. You'll see this week, and in the future, a lot of "Discussion continues..." type posts. I figure as long as there's still new info being added, it's worth another click. And typically you'll be able to tell it's a repeat link by the "Discussion continues", if you don't want to see it again. This week's summary is about an hour late, oops. I was playing Fall Guys to win a skin that looked like Godzilla for [@zaz](@v93CLJG6v9Y8A5yCKrFYfgc03FyqiN0wFN5cCX7jiV0=.ed25519). Hope everyone is doing well, and I'll see you all next week :)

## SSB Post Summary
Welcome to the third edition of SSB Post Summary! Expect these to be roughly every seven days, but not necessarily always on Thursday. To submit a post to the newsletter, dm this account, @ it, or use the #this hashtag.

A few reminders:
- I use the pronouns in profile descriptions, otherwise they/them. If I use the wrong pronouns, let me know! I'll update it in future issues and issue a correction statement if you want.
- I have read all posts linked here, but not necessarily their parent threads or links within posts, so click at your own risk.

Threads linked in this section may contain upsetting or serious content. Use your best judgment. If you're having a rough day, you can always wait to click until tomorrow.

If you have suggestions for SPS or you'd like to contribute feel free to let me know. I appreciate everyone's continued readership and I'll see you all next week!

### Letter from the Author/Editor
Thanks for reading the first issue, everyone! Feel free to talk to me about it in the comments, DMs, or even by DMing my main account, [@romeo](@LrIL+UAvV+msJFiCxKZMJHCDASB8ekaSefbH8qdEwKI=.ed25519). If you want to help contribute, let me know! If you really want something in here but it doesn't fit under the general guidelines, I'll make a section like "Community Submissions" or similar. So don't be shy! On a more personal note, I've found the biggest challenge so far is trying to actually read what I scroll through instead of only skimming to see if it would belong in the SPS (Scuttlebutt Post Summary). It definitely takes a level of mindfulness to consume the content and make that decision simultaneously. Despite that, I think I'm doing well! If the community got huge I would need help with running SPS, but at its current size and with what I can see of it, it takes about a half hour in the morning and evening to catch up and write entries for posts I want to include. And for me, that's manageable! Thanks again for reading, everyone, and if you don't leave feedback, I'll see you in about a week!

# The Fun Begins

First things first. Check out this amazing bamboo case a Moinho artisan made for the LoRa boards:

![lora_bambu.jpg](&xjjKfBWhm5uMp31w7H48bzcEYi9zXgI45LpG0lHyu9k=.sha256)

Today I woke up at 4:30am and drove until 6:30pm, over 1.000Km, but arrived at the town close to the Krahô Indigenous Territory, where I'll be meeting my friend and travelling to his village tomorrow.

The drive was ok. First time driving such long distance alone.

On the last 300Km, which was unexpectedly mostly dirt rode, a family of 3 Xerentes talked me into giving them a ride here, despite covid. They are visiting their daughter who married to a Krahô. We arrived at night, so there was no way for them to travel to the village, so I invited them to stay at a inn and for dinner.

They were the biggest good surprise for this first day. Earlier this year I traveled to the other side of the country with the intention of [visiting the Xavante people](%XOr8EYZLm1HprwTyNevy3g2YeINYq92RiaQV+TnoLSo=.sha256), but covid stopped me in the last second. The Xavante and Xerente were one people, but during the last century as colonizers were expanding their reach, they drove them apart. The Xavante say the Xerente are the ones who choose not to cross the river. I got a chance to read and watch a lot about Xavante culture earlier this year, and my Xerente friends were surprised that I knew a bit about their culture, and I was happy to confirm how alike these two cultures are despite time and geography. 

To give some contrast, comparing the Krahô who are geographically close, and the Xerente: They have to use portuguese as a common language to communicate as their languages are completely different. The Krahô sleep in hammocks, yet the Xerente sleep on mattresses. But they also have commonalities, such as the Log Race.

Tomorrow I'll be going to the village and I'm not sure how connectivity is there. I'll keep on posting even if offline, and sync whenever possible.
Looks like something eat a bunch of corn but can't digest it... 💩
Max-Neef is awesome: %9Db3wW0qqXk98Lte8rqnuskzt33TkdfsjXIk0H6/RLk=.sha256

Been following the Own Project (Ducks?) for some time, probably learned thru [@Nico Pace](@2AWm36HvcuOOcYeNgGgoybKXcMZx+COIf4/aAxJwnVI=.ed25519).

They are into emergency situations, like #disasterradio and [Project Lantern](lantern.works), thus the UI/UX  is thought for that use case. I chose #meshtastic because of it's thriving community, which SSB thought me is the most important aspect of a protocol, and because it's less focused on emergency and more on simple communication.

Nice find [@zelfos](@F9iHl0VX2BOwa2iHQKzGPkn986J1Jf2+u4RhM4oH9BI=.ed25519). I hadn't noticed they had all kinds of ducks now: Disco Duck, Detector Duck, Solar Duck, Porta Duck.... lol

Good inspiration for learning the uses of #lora.

# One week from implementation

Everything is ready for me to leave next Tuesday and drive 800Km to the Krahô territory. Will probably give myself 2 days for the trip. I'll meet my contact at a close-by town and head to the village where I'll be quarantining for some time.

The main objective is to connect two villages which are over 40Km away from each other thru Meshtastic devices and Android app.

![planAB_krahô.jpg](&bKRVBgG6TqHljSzqKLRyh0YaRxqcHz1N+AxqGG3UzCw=.sha256)
*Map with the 6 nodes and where they should be placed for a good chance of linking two distant villages*

After a while studying the territory and simulating the links this seems to be the easiest possible path. There are two other paths we could try if we really wanted to put the setup to the test. Placing two long range nodes at the highest and most central point of the territory[1](%c+yMaH7gYXWvdXauQVTCvl3YX97G62TD+yr6PtQBXbE=.sha256) being the most ambitious.

The second objective is to present the communities to distributed tools that could be of use to them (Ãhau, Mapeo, SSB clients...), the idea of #community-server and do some research on their needs for communication/information tech and where their priorities to connect to are.

Third, but maybe most valuable, is to ask them to document what they learned so that others can replicate the experiment. My initial idea is to, together with them, come up with small scripts for possible topics worth documenting and record small videos in their native language.

 ---------------

Until next week I'll be looking into tuning the Yagi antennas with the help of the Meshtastic community[2](https://meshtastic.discourse.group/t/meshtastic-to-connect-isolated-villages/1191/91), tips are welcome [@emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519) [@Kim Hawtin](@6PBpMUBulZlAQIqMc+snD03SREW3jtdTLyPiJVL48ew=.ed25519).

By looking at the PeachCloud docs the device they're developing on top off is the Raspberry 3+. Correct me if I'm wrong [@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519), but I think there would be no problem using a Pi Zero (maybe change the gpio mappings) or the 3+ since it's also cheap.

Here in Brazil, which includes 100% taxes, a Raspberry Pi 3+ kit (sd card + power supply + board) is costing less then 100 USD. The OLED + controls sells for 22.50 USD + shipping. So we're looking at less then 200 USD.

For the future, adding a LoRa module directly to the Raspberry would be really awesome and would only add a few dollars.

The docs are looking incredible, congrats Glyph and Dino 👏

# 🎉 🎉 🎉 

Uhuuuuul, that's big!

Yup, that sounds like a great plan.

Besides optimizing the stack, I believe we can create a driver between the SSB message format and the Meshtastic format. Leaving the micro-controllers simply replicating data, and more powerful devices doing the actual computing. I believe we'd need to translate and dry JSONs into a [Protocol Buffer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protocol_Buffers) format.

Highly interested in non-corporate end-user devices, specially with long range capabilities. For developing applications it's a dream not having to deal with a hundred-billion Android devices.

I think the Rasp Zero W is a great starting candidate, but also dream about using something like the esp32 for financial accessibility. [@elavoie](@IgYpd+tCtXnlE2tYX/8rR2AGt+P8svC98WH3MdYAa8Y=.ed25519) an esp32 is a micro-controller used by #disaster-radio as well as #meshtastic. I've been looking at the [nRF52805](https://www.nordicsemi.com/Products/Low-power-short-range-wireless/nRF52805) boards as well, since they have much better sleep mode, which saves energy, so makes battery/solar setup cheaper too.

I'd gladly be up for a $ 200 USD device, but that's way off for most community members around here. Something around 50 USD is closer to peoples reality.

> Directly propagate updates when further connected to a LoRa mesh or an HF-based amateur radio network.

I've been investigating ways to bridge Meshtastic + SSB. I believe it's a good starting point in order to make SSB a #transport-agnostic-protocol, making possible to use HF and LoRa as transport.

# Autonomous nodes 🌞 ☎️

The charge controllers arrived, so I could finish up the 10W autonomous nodes:

![autonomous_lora_nodes.jpg](&xIMU33ZsFNlj68QJQGoBwNSsp6w9N/dtV+ClknYS3PM=.sha256)

The smaller 5W nodes have been successfully charging the T-Beam's battery 100% everyday for over a week (all sunny days). The rain is starting now, so let's see how it holds up. The v1.0.0 firmware had a bug where GPS was killing battery life, so during night time 70% of battery would be drained. The v1.1.1 firmware fixed it and added a `router` mode. Now normal mode drains 50% at night, and router mode drains only 30%, which is pretty good.

The 10W are probably an overkill for a single battery, so was thinking on [using a single panel to power two boards](%Ef5IV3ziTfjNG5/FRp+lmlCR2uCTJ6UvFwnWavUOHEc=.sha256). Donno the best approach for doing that though.

The two [Rak4600s](https://store.rakwireless.com/products/rak4600-evaluation-board) arrived. [@sam_uk](@s5nSo+j0D+tTklVi1kZqDsgEV0mLtums7UgyGAClD/0=.ed25519) advised to test em out, as their very efficient sleep mode could give a much better energy performance. But still haven't figured out how to build Meshtastic firmware for them.

mentions.name: using a single panel to power two boards

content.text:
I need to charge the battery of two TTGo T-Beam devices from one single 10W panel. What's best:

1. Use two [controllers](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-826484709-kit-10x-mini-controlador-de-carga-usb-2amp-6v-20v-carregador-_JM)

2. Use a single controller and a [usb hub](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1610460238-mini-hub-180-graus-c-3-portas-usb-lelong-hub-usb-20-_JM)

# Antenna tuning

Here's the result of our first attempts at tuning a ground-plane:

![tuned_ground_plane.jpg](&e3T07HPxMdnf6zfWnKbQ0bLXcOgyBCmLhnuxVn6ZqL0=.sha256)

Tried following your guide [@Kim Hawtin](@6PBpMUBulZlAQIqMc+snD03SREW3jtdTLyPiJVL48ew=.ed25519), but we also went crazy and started experimenting a lot.

First thing we did was leave the vertical radial and a single side radial. With the radials close to 80mm the resonance was at around 860Mhz. We found it strange that we had to cut the radial sizes to around 68mm which is 20mm smaller then the calculated 78mm for 915Mhz. According to [this Return Loss vs VSWR table](https://www.minicircuits.com/app/DG03-111.pdf) we're at 1.4 SWR which is pretty good, am I interpreting this right?

The graph isn't looking reallly good yet, but it was good practice to understand the relation between the radial sizes, angles and quantity.

They suggested using the [Amateus Radio Toolkit app](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.daveyhollenberg.amateurradiotoolkit) at the Meshtastic forum. This is the calculation for a 915Mhz ground-plane:

![amateur_radio_tool_kit_915_groundplane.jpg](&b1RBLvNyYFLckwL80oHN/YYv+9/nws5ZA/ofql3bqcY=.sha256)

Very different from [the reference I used](http://www.csgnetwork.com/antennagpcalc.html). The vertical monopole it the same, but the radials are of different length.

This is an interesting discussion. [@IBob](@vkdMlsuBgzzo5eLS3LZLdqnBpZ26OauJOMIq9gQ2E7E=.ed25519) brings an interesting point, it's like tap water. I've built a lifestyle to counter that, and by staying with Dominic for a week, it seemed he used similar tactics. Even if I earn more, there's no way I can really spend more on my daily life, besides travelling.

I don't pay taxes as a political stance, and haven't had any problems so far, so I don't have exact numbers. But I'll guess just to give some contrast to everyone else living in highly-industrialized parts of the world.

 The monthly spending for both me and [@Isabela](@Xe+wuSGAaEdwgyI/ql2WVgPG64Mqf8tVHU0VXne9Ki8=.ed25519) together is at around R$1000~R$1500 (180 ~ 270 USD). I'll throw in extras that always show up (construction, car maintenance, etc), so yearly I'm guessing at around 3600 USD. This is maybe twice of what an average person in Brazilian territory earns and spends.


I've earned quite a lot this year (compared to previous years), but the extra I spend on personal projects such as [this](%hMC/Ix/mnDvk0KYGcvXGo/Kt8UuegWYz6vB91RyhIKQ=.sha256).

🙏 [@emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519) and [@Kim Hawtin](@6PBpMUBulZlAQIqMc+snD03SREW3jtdTLyPiJVL48ew=.ed25519)! With all that info things are slowly making sense.

Also got some tips from the peoples at the #meshtastic forum, and I think this is looking more like it should:

![atenna_vector.jpg](&36eF5dQEV+0z9fHxl5ECqI22+/jyL8xrNZ24iy9gYS8=.sha256)

# Building antenna and using vector analyzer to test and tune

The [N type chassi mount](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1477138892-5x-114540-conector-tipo-n-fmea-base-quadrada-antena-rural-_JM) and the [sma cables](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1662569225-kit-10-pc-cabo-de-descida-rgc-58-n-macho-sma-macho-010-mt-_JM) for building a simple ground plane antennas arrived. I followed [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JeUexihrKZQ) and used a [ground plane calculator](http://www.csgnetwork.com/antennagpcalc.html) to make sure the measurements were correct. In the case of 915Mhz all 5 radials should measure 7.8cm. We cut them with 8cm so we can better tune them later.

The [Nano VNA v2](https://aliexpress.com/item/4000390703223.html) also arrived, and by following [this](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QJYeFpiqY8c&ab_channel=w2aew) and [this](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JqpGvYg1XDs&ab_channel=RobertJ.Meade) video, I was able to **calibrate**, **set the right scales** and learn to **navigate** the device, which is much more complex them it seems.

I still haven't soldered the copper rods to the chassi-mount, as I believe there are still some tuning to do. But it's been enough to get some measurements from the vector analyzer.

With the factory omni antenna:

![test_antena.jpg](&GXqrwRCY9+n2xSnpeYUaGGxoJblSIXCTcEgYb+2iab4=.sha256)

If this is calibrated well the SWR is quite high at **3.25**, from what I learned it should be bellow 2. There also a **logmag**  which has **-46db**, but I'm not sure what that means.

With the DIY ground-plane antenna and a 10cm cable:

![ground_plane_test.jpg](&OcScEZTP0bxGBdJ0asO3ZmAg6zkf6ibh+3fKqgdJuCo=.sha256)
 
The SWR is at **1.63**, which as far as I know is ok, and the logmag shows **-67Db**, which at first seems worse then the factory antenna.

-----------

I believe that will get better results after soldering the radials, but still not sure how to use this to tune.

Tips on how to interpret this [@emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519)?
I've heard that speech a thousand times now, always wondered whose it was 👍

Just made what I believe are the last orders for the first prototypes:

- 20 x [v8 USB cables](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1051646998-20-cabos-usb-v8-micro-usb-universal-atacado-lote-_JM): R$73,00 ($ 0.18 USD each)

- [5V 5W portable solar charger](https://www.neosolar.com.br/loja/carregador-solar-portatil-5w-com-usb-neosolar.html): R$ 142,50 / *$ 27.00 USD* each

- [Weather-proof case](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1199130696-10-caixas-proteco-organizadoras-cftv-de-sobrepor-_JM): R$ 5,50 / *$ 1.10 USD* each

This is incredibly low price for a full node. We're only missing here the pole, which I'll hope for some ingenious indigenous creativity and knowledge of local resources.

We're expecting these nodes will be able to transmit over 43Km from the hill-top at the center of the territory to nodes at villages at 150m lower altitude. Expecting only the lowest bandwidth for LoRa at 0.3Kbs.

There's a valve that stops the water from flowing to the low part of the village, and people have been turning it on and off without any real conversation going on.... Kinda sad.

One neighbor from the top part started being vocal about the issue, so I presented the prototype to him, and asked if he would like to test it at his house, as a way to collect data about the water issue and make it public thru the portal being built by #rede-moinho. All his relatives are visiting, so he asked for some time so that they can decide collectively. Hopefully we'll start testing soon.

# SSB Localization ♈ ♉

![video:ahau_localization_min.webm](&J06f9hb3eZ83C7iQnYwj5gFgw3kBTjA4nkOJNN/eFP4=.sha256)

*Video with a concept for localization ih Ahau, with indigenous communities from the Brazilian territory in mind*

I've been trying to on-board my local community as well as other peers from Latin America into SSB for the past 3 years. The biggest block I've found has been the English language, as SSB's content to non-english speakers makes no sense. It would make a lot of sense that every message had a `language` type, and messages could be filtered by the ones users select.

Working with #ahau, which is the codebase I'm most familiar with, I built this really crude proof-of-concept for onboarding based on language. For Ahau, which has indigenous peoples as primary users, language is one of the most crucial aspects connecting to one's identity. And most indigenous cultures, at least in Latin America, are of oral culture, so it makes sense to take care to present information with images and sound.

This is very crude, and there are still english sentences and words that needs to be translated into icons. The idea with this is just to start a conversation that I feel is very important. This is crucial for Ahau, but also a must-have for other clients in order to give a better experience for non-english speakers, and if we really want #diversity, also for oral cultures.

Play with it at the `localization-concept` branch of [Ahau app](https://gitlab.com/ahau/whakapapa-ora/-/tree/localization-concept).  cc.: [@mixmix](@ye+QM09iPcDJD6YvQYjoQc7sLF/IFhmNbEqgdzQo3lQ=.ed25519) [@Maui](@ood2kZqCeg7VCdVq2JAzxjtmZT9EXYVYNgAK4HRZMYs=.ed25519)

I love that [@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519)! I can really see where that's useful, as GSM is the only access to the internet many people have.

Really excited for the feature that allows replication with local peers but not remote peers. That's really useful. ❤️

## Extra LoRa boards, batteries and cases arrived 🎉

Finally got to building the prototype for the community water management system. Following this schematics:

![comuRede_esquema.jpeg](&Qe5eIVGdpTypYe74xext3uLBx/EgJNR+2qJXRQrdZz8=.sha256)

The only problem I'm having is that when powering the Nodemcu with the battery thru *VIN* it seems the *YF-S201* water flow meter isn't powered. The schematics has a relay, but it's not clear to me between the flow-meter and the micro-controller where should this relay be placed.

Will keep on investigating, but any tips are welcome.

Awesome document on building yagis, thanks for sharing [@Kim Hawtin](@6PBpMUBulZlAQIqMc+snD03SREW3jtdTLyPiJVL48ew=.ed25519)!

I bought one of thos Nanovnas from China, let's see if it arrives. Really looking forward to start DIYing antennas.

Thanks for the tips of temperature change, not really sure what to expect from the terrain, we'll see when we arrive there. For now I'm going with two nodes at the highest hills using directional antennas, I believe #meshtastic works by store-forwarding. But I'm not sure I understand what u mean by single or multi-nodes.

Yup [@hoodownr imagination](@YND2Cb9uk3ZdFyzXpaXDH5HZ9udu+qjg4MhNcynK2RE=.ed25519), I believe it's 300bps. Not much, but we can make it be enough.
Ohhh I envy u. Just ran out of fire wood, rely 100% on it for cooking and rainy season will be arriving soon.

❤️ ♥️ [@Mix Android](@G98XybiXD/amO9S/UyBKnWTWZnSKYS3YVB/5osSRHvY=.ed25519) & [@graham](@LEkAGbzqsXLzBxLEPhkNluDHbPnkU6PXGyqwjqY10Tk=.ed25519) ♥️❤️ 

Wanna use some of my personal savings for now, but would love contributions later on, when at least the first experiment has taken place. Gonna try a #circular-economy type of strategy, getting funds back from one project in order to fund a next one. Sounds like a good idea?

# First prototype underway

Just placed the order for the equipment I'll be using for [the first experiment](http://localhost:8989/blobs/get/&AtCn4UM5WsnzaNds/a5ErkNWAnXtY/AlmcxCqrOMJ+w=.sha256?).

### From Brazil
- **3x** [TTGO T-BEAM boards](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1423471429-ttgo-t-beam-esp32-lora-868915mhz-wifi-gps-neo-6m-18650-_JM) - **R$650,00** (123 USD)
- **5x** [TTGO LoRa32 boards](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1650122501-5x-modulo-wifi-esp32-com-suporte-de-bateria-gps-lora-915mhz-_JM) - **R$1040,00** (200 USD)
- **8x** [18650 8000mah Yuas Li-ion 3.7v 30a](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1645233513-lote-2xbateria-cr-18650-8000mah-yuas-li-ion-37v-30a-_JM) (definately fake) - **R$225,00** (44 USD)
- **2x** [20dbi yagi 850/900Mhz antenna's](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1379985036-antena-celular-rural-externa-dualband-20dbi-850-e-900mhz-pro-_JM) - **R$333,00** (65 USD)
- **10x** [Watherproof cases](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1199130696-10-caixas-proteco-organizadoras-cftv-de-sobrepor-_JM) - **R$55,00** (11 USD)
- **2x** [5W 5V solar charger](https://www.neosolar.com.br/loja/carregador-solar-portatil-5w-com-usb-neosolar.html) - **R$285,00** (54 USD)
- **2x** [10W solar panel](https://www.neosolar.com.br/loja/painel-solar-fotovoltaico-10w-sinosola-sa10-36p.html) - **R$225,00** (43 USD)

### From China (not counting on them to arrive in time)
- **2x** [Rak4600 boards](https://aliexpress.com/item/4000344205753.html) - **65.25 USD**
- **7x** [5dbi 916Mhz moxon antennas](https://aliexpress.com/item/4001346497567.html) - **70.00 USD**
- **1x** [nanovna v2 vector analizer](https://aliexpress.com/item/4000390703223.html) - **63.10 USD**

So far totaling **740,35 USD**. It's probably twice the cost people in any other part of the world would pay ( 🇧🇷 highest import taxes in the world), but it's still very cheap compared to any other connectivity solution that I know of (HF Radio, GSM, 5Ghz). There are still small parts that are missing like cables, bolts, etc, and of course the poles to set the LoRa kits, which we'll be using wood or bamboo extracted close to the sites.

There's a strike of the national delivery service going on, so some items will probably be delayed. Expecting to start building a first prototype and testing it by the end of September, and trying to organize a trip to the territory by mid October. Wish us luck 🤞

## Quick update

Went to town to test if I could get signal on the possible areas pointed out by the simulation on [Test 1](%c+yMaH7gYXWvdXauQVTCvl3YX97G62TD+yr6PtQBXbE=.sha256), but got none within the urban area. I'm guessing it's because there are too many buildings, maybe in a higher place...

That concludes the first test. Positively surprised by the outcome.

👏 👏 👏 [@Rômulo Alves](@xr/Q/zqaEwmmd4wg8xRU1TrMLQhc9qBqNCioCqmv1vQ=.ed25519)!

Very awaited feature. I hope to collaborate in adding audio recording.
😢 What happened? His books have had a big influence on my personal development.

[@sam_uk](@s5nSo+j0D+tTklVi1kZqDsgEV0mLtums7UgyGAClD/0=.ed25519)

> I’d avoid a exposed USB, I think it will rust within 6-12 months.

My plan so far has been to cover it with silicon and then with epoxy resin, just to make sure. Any better ideas are really welcome :)

> I don’t know if you’ve come across Rachel/ World possible?

I'm never really tested it, but heard a lot about Rachel. At #coolab we've been slowly writing scripts for our a custom pi-server, to fit the needs of the communities we interact with. In the [community-portal app](https://moinho.network) I've added a space for "Apps", which doesn't have much yet. The list u have there is really great, I'll definitely include some of those apps. Thanks for sharing.

--------------
This is incredible resource [@emile](@2YVYXQclEJHVzCON5dsLRwf65b2S6HnvxpGS8/LwjwY=.ed25519) 🙏 

 [Beyond Line-of-Sight UHF Digital Communications with the LoRa Spread Spectrum Waveform.pdf](&0GrbSXzQqexXOCEybe5p9OMzRc0bAGEYjLAkvBGWi+U=.sha256)

Bits I found relevant:
- troposcatter allows for communications up to about 700km (using LoRa), with diffraction being limited to even shorter distances
-  they require a substantial link budget that requires high receive sensitivity, high transmit power, and high antenna gain
- diffraction is generally useful for shorter distance BLoS
- at longer distances, troposcatter provides BLoS propagation by scattering radio waves off irregularities in density and moisture in the upper troposphere. Troposcatter is a reliable communication method, but its effectiveness does vary based on weather conditions and can suffer from fast fading issues
- total path loss is at least 160-170dB for troposcatter communications
-  the 915MHz product and the 433MHz product align with the 70cm and 33cm amateur bands respectively.
-  the 433MHz product was used mainly to leverage the abundance of 70cm amateur radio
equipment, including low-cost antennas and power amplifiers; and feedline losses are lower on
lower frequencies
- [Halo antenna on the cheap](http://www.kr1st.com/70cmstack.htm)
- [Yagi antenna on the cheap](http://wa5vjb.com/yagi-pdf/cheapyagi.pdf)
- [LoRa airtime calculator](https://www.loratools.nl/#/airtime)

For the specific case of the Krahô territory, in the savanna, the geography and vegetation are blessings, so having a node at the center enables communication in most parts of the territory. But troposcatter is very relevant for the Amazon region. The amplifier might be the trick, as they seem to be a bit pricey and doing a quick search I can't even seem to find one in Brazil.

content.text:
*Re-posting from ["meshtastic to connect isolate villages"](https://meshtastic.discourse.group/t/meshtastic-to-connect-isolated-villages) thread*
# Test 1

Just did a test, placing a T-Beam on top of the hill where the main #librerouter node in #moinho-mesh sits.

![lora_torre_moinho_teste1.jpg](&KADPrUXxB09s7D30ZtGXFo5GpJOzHEr7zvrEYcEa33Q=.sha256)

The green area is the expected reach using the simulation. Unfortunately I didn't have the map with me to check exactly where to get the best signal in the nearby town (Alto Paraíso de Goiás), so I drove to the wrong places to test. The green and red lines are where I drove and got signal (green 💚 ) or not (red 🔴 )

But I was very surprised with these results, I was expecting to climb a hill to get a message through, but from inside the car messages were being sent no problem (using the maximum range/lowest speed settings). Within #moinho I got a connection everywhere.

# Star network

Based on the simulation for the Krahô territory I've decided to change strategies, and go for the best spot on the whole territory, making possible for all villages to connect. The trick here is to either have a really good omni:

![lora_kraho_central_nodes_omni.jpg](&TJC7z0l/OJlKDh1LlsokyrmQLEvq5RUBcGRdbJsQR14=.sha256)

Or place two nodes at the 435m high hill, each one with a yagi, which might be more guarateed to work, but would require placing more nodes at the center in case villages in the other directions want join the network:

![lora_kraho_central_nodes_yagi.jpg](&AtCn4UM5WsnzaNds/a5ErkNWAnXtY/AlmcxCqrOMJ+w=.sha256)

Probably worth testing the two options, by first placing nodes at the villages, then going up the hill and testing omni and yagis.

Almost decided on the kit I'll be going for, based on **simplicity** (for less points of failure), **price** and national **availability**.

- **5x** [5W pannel with 5V USB](https://www.neosolar.com.br/loja/carregador-solar-portatil-5w-com-usb-neosolar.html) - **R$ 110,00** (22.55 USD each)
- **5x** [TTGO LoRa](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1183694492-modulo-wifi-esp32-com-suporte-de-bateria-gps-e-lora-915mhz-_JM) - **R$ 220,00** (41.00 USD each)
- **1x** [Omni antenna](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-905740373-antena-omni-veicular-15-dbi-824-2600-mhz-_JM) (still not ideal, but only one I could find) - **R$ 325,00** (61.00 USD)
- **2x** [Yagi antenas](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1516947026-antena-externa-para-celular-18-dbi-806-a-960-mhz-_JM) (806-960mhz) - **R$ 107,00** (20.00 USD each)
- **5 meters of** [copper tubing](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1506079214-cano-cobre-38-para-tubulaco-gas-glp-ar-condicionado-split-_JM) (to test making antennas) - **R$ 127,00** (24.00 USD)
#rede-moinho

# The first experiment

I've been in touch with our Krahô collaborator and he's really excited for the experiment. He has confirmed support from the community for lodging and food during my stay. Besides doing this experiment I'm hoping to introduce them to tools such as #mapeo, #ahau, #manyverse, #huiom and the #librerouter, which might be of use to them.

I've been thinking on driving there during the first two weeks of October. But until then, there are still tests to do, and an equipment list to define and buy. I'll be using my own savings, but hope to crowd-fund it back later on.

This is a first draft of the mesh plan we'll be attempting at their territory.

![link_LORA_manuelalves_serragrande.jpg](&SE34VdPdHUa4R22MCYNQ74Ro1Gm4xXJJz5h4KtDIVzo=.sha256)
*A mesh plan using 5 repeater nodes to bridge 2 villages that are 43.2Km away*

I've started to interact with the Meshtastic community thru this topic on their discourse channel: [Meshtastic to connect isolated villages](https://meshtastic.discourse.group/t/meshtastic-to-connect-isolated-villages)

They've been giving me good tips on antennas, solar setups and on how realistic such a mesh is. Good tips include using panel with 5V output in order connect it directly to the board to use less parts and have as few failure points as possible and using DIY omni antennas for the repeaters (looking at [this tutorial](https://youtu.be/1_1LxuOngHs)).

Here's the equipment list so far:
- [5x Heltec LoRa boards](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1645061816-5-x-placa-lora-esp32-display-oled-wifi-bluetooth-_JM)
- [5x 5W 5v panels with USB](https://www.neosolar.com.br/loja/carregador-solar-portatil-5w-com-usb-neosolar.html)
- [5x 2200mah 18650 batteries](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1180892186-bateria-18650-samsung-22p-original-2200mah-kit-4-_JM)
- [5x 18650 battery cases](https://produto.mercadolivre.com.br/MLB-1210664880-kit-5-case-suporte-bateria-18650-para-1-bateria-37v-_JM)
- Copper for making DIY antennas (haven't found the ideal material for this yet)

All these are available here in Brasil. I'll be buying Moxon antennas and Rak4600 boards from Aliexpress, but won't be counting on them for this as things from China usually takes months to arrive (if they do).

## Test 1

Been learning to use an amazing tool for simulating radio coverage: [https://www.ve2dbe.com/rmonline_s.asp](https://www.ve2dbe.com/rmonline_s.asp)

Got a few of the settings from [this thread](https://meshtastic.discourse.group/t/how-to-fill-in-coverage-details-on-ve2dbe-com), but still feel it's not exactly right. Any tips are welcome.

This is the test I'll be attempting in the next few days, communicating between the two T-Beams over 7,44Km using the Meshtastic app.

![lora_moinho_conecta_link.jpg](&jB5rcl5XtnsSyLtEUJf3wp6WRJqCh3UIN9YCxlMp8Bw=.sha256)
*Map with the expected coverage of a LoRa node placed where our #moinho-mesh hill node is*

Yea, also gave consent. Interesting, didn't know the actual feed was bundled. I've authorized the viewer to display my feed, which for me is a great way to share the stuff I'm doing to the outside world, so see no harm in letting Planetary use it.

- **On the  Rak4600**: That looks like a great board. The existing nrf52dk target in meshtastic is almost exactly the same, so I bet adding it will not be too hard. I’m happy to help with questions. [Source](https://meshtastic.discourse.group/t/25-low-power-dev-board-with-solar-rak4600/410/7?u=luandro)

- It sounds like there are a couple of folks working on getting a NRF52 and/or sx1262 boards out. As soon as something like that exists I bet that will be the ideal repeater node (because super low power draw and better radio performance). [Source](https://meshtastic.discourse.group/t/headless-base-station-repeater/363/2?u=luandro)

- **Global messaging support** (not really about the NRF52, but related to integrating SSB+LoRa): the appeal adding an optional internet gateway is so “whenever some member of your mesh happens to connect to the internet, it will magically send/receive messages to/from any internet user”. [Source](https://meshtastic.discourse.group/t/proposal-for-global-messaging-support/455/31?u=luandro)

Ok, my internet let me do some real research now. What I found about NRF52:

- On **Ultra Low Power Nodes**: This board should be able to do exactly what you describe even without having the mesh sleep (because the nrf52 and the sx1262 have absurdly low power draws while in receive mode). According to my spreadsheet his board should be able to run indefinitely as a “router” with a quite small solar cell. So you could place one of these devices (discreetly) in a tree that has good line of sight for a region and it would happily route packets for that whole area (using just a tiny solar cell). [Source](https://meshtastic.discourse.group/t/ultra-low-power-nodes/218/2?u=luandro)

- [Meshtastic airtime and current draws spreadsheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ft1bS3iXqFKU8SApU8ZLTq9r7QQEGESYnVgdtvdT67k/edit#gid=1182643433)

[@sam_uk](@s5nSo+j0D+tTklVi1kZqDsgEV0mLtums7UgyGAClD/0=.ed25519) it's always a trade-off huh? I guess we'd need to do more testing to really find out the sweet spot we should be aiming for.

I feel Disaster Radio is more aligned with the aim here, but Meshtastic does seem to have a lot of momentum, and an active community behind.

Been doing some research on the NRF52, but didn't really understand it's advantage. Is it the power efficiency? Can it run with less battery/solar power?

QMesh is exactly what I'm aiming for in the future, thanks for sharing 👍

Wow [@Nico Pace](@2AWm36HvcuOOcYeNgGgoybKXcMZx+COIf4/aAxJwnVI=.ed25519), Code 2 looks really promising. And it seems there has been [some work on getting it to work with micro-controllers](https://github.com/blanu/codec2-arduino). Thanks for the great tip 👍 

Really feel this is moving, thanks everyone :)

🙏 Thank you very much [@juul](@22YV3HX/BGClXH49ZebkcepqRpj7a9f5s0ddwhDSfxk=.ed25519). That's definitely sounds amazing. Excited for a chat!

I'm definitely a huge fan of Mapeo. Have chatted with [@Kira](@C3iYh/12sO1uvKq1KcZXLFxSySzxOkHxXN8rtNB5MGA=.ed25519) in person about it, and always following the work she and [@karissa](@hCDeKTwEhhhNXtg00adkMDi+tx6qrRApFFj49QBM3lY=.ed25519) have been doing.

I'm thinking on low bandwidth as an advantage in such situations. That's because we really don't want to affect peoples ways of lives with high-bandwidth communication and mobile devices. If they really need it, sure, let's think of a very expensive project that uses 5.8Ghz, big solar setups and gives people smartphones (I personally think that would be a huge mistake). But until then, here's this cheap, low-bandwidth solution that can let the village communicate at 1kbs and go on with it's traditions, which is what HF gives as well anyways. That's the idea.

[@SoapDog (Macbook)](@qv10rF4IsmxRZb7g5ekJ33EakYBpdrmV/vtP1ij5BS4=.ed25519) I've also thought of this idea of pre-made codes. I really  think that's the way to go. But would also love to test highly compressed audio, probably not feasible, but worth testing the limits. I'm thinking p2p all the way, certainly there aren't any gateways in these places anyways.

An advantage of these territories is that they are sovereign, so brazilian laws should not apply to them. And they're so remote, and deep in the forest that I can't imagine an [ANATEL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Telecommunications_Agency_(Brazil)) agent going there to try and shutdown a node that isn't complying to national laws.

So this is a great opportunity to hack LoRa to be as efficient as possible, without giving a s*** to regulations (I love that btw, can you feel the excitement of me saying that?).

 [@sam_uk](@s5nSo+j0D+tTklVi1kZqDsgEV0mLtums7UgyGAClD/0=.ed25519), if there were no constraints, what kind of tweaking could we do with LoRa to make it as efficient as possible?

Wow, that's an awesome project [@SoapDog (Macbook)](@qv10rF4IsmxRZb7g5ekJ33EakYBpdrmV/vtP1ij5BS4=.ed25519)! The use of the PVC tube + rangefinder in really smart.

I don't have a use-case for this yet. But hopefully in the future, once I'm in the ground at the forest, I'm sure such river-flooding warning system will be of huge use.

Thank you for sharing 🙏

*Qual.net* looks really awesome [@zenna](@3ZeNUiYQZisGC6PLf3R+u2s5avtxLsXC66xuK41e6Zk=.ed25519). But for this specific use case that I'm starting to journey into, the reliance on WiFi and even normal devices (phones and computers) don't fit. 

Geography has helped preserve these ways-of-life which present an alternative, thus are a threat, to the self-destructive *status quo*. But, as the forest that they depend on, they are under constant threat and are fragile, as the whole world seems to be "against" them. The geography that has protected them up until now present it's own challenges for resistance.

The concepts used by *Qual.net* and *SSB*, just to name a few, are amazing but need to be expanded to use other radio communication technologies such as LoRa or HF, and other devices such #disasterradio. Something ideal for this specific use case would be a disaster-radio + #peachcloud device. **Cheap, low-power, long-range**.

The work [@adria0](@ZFWw+UclcUgYi081/C8lhgH+KQ9s7YJRoOYGnzxW/JQ=.ed25519) and [@glyph](@HEqy940T6uB+T+d9Jaa58aNfRzLx9eRWqkZljBmnkmk=.ed25519) are doing with SSB on micro-controllers are a huge step in that direction, I hope to join their efforts in the future. For now I'm experimenting with LoRa tech to learn of it's possibilities, as something as simple as text messaging could mean saving peoples lives, peoples cultures and peoples territories.

# 🎉 ![hermes butt dancing](&utxo7ToSNDhHpXpgrEhJo46gwht7PBG3nIgzlUTMmgU=.sha256) ![hermes butt dancing](&utxo7ToSNDhHpXpgrEhJo46gwht7PBG3nIgzlUTMmgU=.sha256) ![hermes butt dancing](&utxo7ToSNDhHpXpgrEhJo46gwht7PBG3nIgzlUTMmgU=.sha256) ![hermes butt dancing](&utxo7ToSNDhHpXpgrEhJo46gwht7PBG3nIgzlUTMmgU=.sha256) ![hermes butt dancing](&utxo7ToSNDhHpXpgrEhJo46gwht7PBG3nIgzlUTMmgU=.sha256) ![hermes butt dancing](&utxo7ToSNDhHpXpgrEhJo46gwht7PBG3nIgzlUTMmgU=.sha256) 🎉

That's an awesome invocation [@Nico Pace](@2AWm36HvcuOOcYeNgGgoybKXcMZx+COIf4/aAxJwnVI=.ed25519)!

We're actually going to take a first step in that direction in #coolab for Catalytics. Bruno will be connecting an esp to the LibreRouter to monitor energy and uptime.

For the use case of villages without electricity, I've been imagining an esp deep-sleeping and waking up every once in a while and turning on it's wifi, which shows a captive portal that can trigger a LibreRouter to turn on.

But because of brazilian taxes the LR is still a distant reality for most. We'd need a much cheaper version of it for it to scale.

## Quick update

[@Emmi](@5fX6QTmue/udf7tLwW25vQ63wZSENrksghBt6vfL4/I=.ed25519), I'm still trying to setup one for #moinho-mesh, but as OpenCollective only works with Stripe, which is still in Beta in Brazil, and direct bank transfer. So I still haven't anything setup yet, will take some time to do that. Thanks for the interest, it's motivating :)

![lora_test_1.jpg](&1geXTD21HAfGBkVE5+fWd5SKc1hAMrfsu3lQ3EjnTFA=.sha256)


Connecting the T-Beams with the phones using Meshtastic was pretty easy today, not sure why. Was able to do the first tests.

Went for a drive around the village with one device and left another inside my house (hay walls and roofing). Messages were coming thru fine until the hill flattened, and got on the way. Was using the default configs. Since it was getting late I didn't do any more testing. Will find good spots to do long rage tests, and lower the configs to less speed and more range. Got 600m distance for now.

# LoRa: Hello world

Thanks [@abekonge.too](@xf25ivgqN8m7GvaZBVm5lOgGgBm4SBmuTY05as9Duos=.ed25519) and [@Emmi](@5fX6QTmue/udf7tLwW25vQ63wZSENrksghBt6vfL4/I=.ed25519) :) I'm writing a really small and simple project together with our indigenous allies and hope to do some crowdfunding in the future. Anyone who would like to contribute in any way is really welcome.

I've also got a new indigenous ally from the [Krahô](https://pib.socioambiental.org/en/Povo:Krah%C3%B4) tribe. I visited a few of their villages back in 2016 with my mother and daughter, and now they're in real need for communication in the most isolated villages to resist #covid19. I started mapping their territory, but still waiting for some village gps positions, as they don't show on my map.

![t_beams.jpg](&epC7xSacqfLAGaYFc4BAGXkV3fHTkB+7i4DbAwe2y3k=.sha256)

Just acquired these cute little toys. These [TTGO-T-Beam](https://github.com/LilyGO/TTGO-T-Beam) cost way more here then elsewhere in the world. I found them used for $ 42.50 USD each, with battery, case and screen included. Once I've learned the basics I hope to acquire more boards from Aliexpress for cheaper, but brazilian customs is a pain, and I've had stuff get stuck with them before, so a bit afraid to do that.

## Testing

First firmware I tried was [Meshtastic](https://www.meshtastic.org/), as this device seems to be made for it and they have ready-to-go [bin files](https://github.com/meshtastic/Meshtastic-device/releases). Installing everything was really straight forward, but I a hard time connecting the T-Beams to the phone app. But after trying a bunch I was finally able to a get a few messages thru, but my phone battery died before I could actually do some real range testing with them. I haven't been able to get two phones connected to it since. Opened an [issue](https://github.com/meshtastic/Meshtastic-Android/issues/137), and the main developer and maintainer for the project was fast in responding.

Next up I tried #sudomesh #disasterradio. Steps:
 - `git clone git@github.com:sudomesh/disaster-radio.git`
- Install platformio cli
- `cd firmware && pio run -e ttgo-lora32-tbeam -t upload -t uploadfs`
- modify `platformio.ini`'s `monitor_speed` to this boards speed: 921600
- `pio device monitor` to see the device logs

Seem to be getting something from the board:
```GPS fix type 3
Update DB node 0xabfa10d8, rx_time=1598463937
Node status update: 1 online, 1 total
New GPS pos lat=-14.xxxx, lon=-47.xxxx, alt=887, pdop=2.350000, heading=27790.964850, sats=7
```
Although Bluetooth lights on the board are blinking, I can't seem to be able to find it on the phone. I'm guessing the firmware I'm using is for the T-Beam V0.7, and there's no support for this [T-Beam v1](https://github.com/sudomesh/disaster-radio/issues/33) (?). Here a pic of the board:

# Community Local Market

### 12/08/2020

[APC](https://www.apc.org/) granted #moinho-mesh $2900 USD for us to conduct emergency activities in our community. This may not seem as much, but the with the USD being valued over 5x the BRL, it's a significant amount, specially in a small village such as ours. The writing of this small project was done mainly by a group of women from the village who have been involved in organizing and maintaining a local solidarity market in the form of a WhatsApp group.

The planned activities need to be conducted by the end of the year, starting next week. Based on our 2 years experience, we decided to focus less in technology and more on educating and involving the community. As we've been too focused on technology our group hasn't been very diverse, with mostly men. So this time we have diversity as a core value, aiming to have at least 50% women and at least 50% natives. We'll be organizing an open call for anyone who would like to be involved in the activities to apply and work with us. The areas we'll be working on are: technology (mesh network, [community-server](https://github.com/MoinhoDigital/community-server), [community portal](https://github.com/moinhodigital/community-portal)), communication (documenting the process and creating a monthly newspaper) and community research (gathering economic data and educating on the use of the app).

I'll be updating the [community portal](https://moinho.network/) to include a local market page, which is built with [Gridsome](https://gridsome.org/) to make it easy to edit with Markdown. I'll be teaching at least two other people from the village on how to maintain and update the app. I'll be spreading local-servers (Router running LibreRouterOS + Single-board computers donated by [@benhylau](@Ys9lgBLC0MfPUQrbqd0hddjbjElx7ZNvtikxvMIaqgs=.ed25519)) on key places around the village to guarantee the services to be accessible. The app will also be online, as most people already have Internet access.

Then every month a group will be going door-by-door showing people how to use this local market and asking them for goods and services they would like to include in it. They will also be responsible for researching public services from town which we have the right too make use of, such as doctors, dentists, social care, etc. A small local newspaper will be designed and printed monthly, and spread around the village and the town with all this info, to really guarantee accessibility even for those who aren't into digital devices.

In total we're planning to have around 15 people working with us a few hours a month and expected to positively impact the whole village and it's surroundings. Might seem a bit ambitious for such a small grant, but after 3 meetings our whole team feels pretty positive about it.

I've been keeping an eye on the work being done by [@pospi](@Oqa5JW8rwWIVLBu38KkIb1IYz6Ax0yHuwRvLEGR1mkY=.ed25519), [@bobhaugen](@iL6NzQoOLFP18pCpprkbY80DMtiG4JFFtVSVUaoGsOQ=.ed25519), [@Lynn Foster](@g0xA0PhPzNInPFwPq3VoKcx56KZ9PFqY0QiJnKXx3co=.ed25519), [@Mayel](@aTQuVwkglxM9TABZlDBk1NF4rqfe1v6yjyH+KFb3mPI=.ed25519), [@ivan](@XZckLAZUD7b+HzVuNN1IcRBt/H7Lh9rx//WOmzhBpTc=.ed25519) and others on #valueflows UI applications. Really hope to use it and collaborate in the future.

I've recently setup an [Open Collective for Moinho](https://opencollective.com/rede-moinho), in hopes of getting some micro-donations to keep our experiments going even without any grants. [@Isabela](@Xe+wuSGAaEdwgyI/ql2WVgPG64Mqf8tVHU0VXne9Ki8=.ed25519) is making a nice drawing which I'll update the page soon when that's done. Also seeking some help on setting a Fiscal Host, maybe [@Alanna](@6OxffMLNyxkboLjCqv29WnMPhH8O3qFrcXCR6KrKcPI=.ed25519) can clarify how that works?

Errata: when I talk of cultures of the Earth, I actually mean cultures of Mother Nature. From:
> We know that Mother Nature has a culture, and it is a Native culture
> Yupiaq scholar, Oscar Kawagley

One could claim every culture is of planet Earth, but I'm not referring to the dead stone sphere floating on space.

# Connecting peoples of the Earth



For some years now I've had a growing urge to connect with my ancestry and the cultures of Earth, to help in any way I can with their resistance and learn the art of #buenvivir.

Last year's  [Kayapo Mesh](%tRXIdEOhhPhMf8ExbjsAquFPsLubCAyeGOi791QyDEQ=.sha256) project got lost in bureaucracies up until this day. This year I decided to do as I've done in the past, and go to the communities by my own means, with the goal of sharing the knowledge I had gathered in the past years in #communitynetworks and #distributedtech, but #covid19 stopped me.

But this year was awesome in the sense that I had the opportunity to connect to some key people who are fighting for indigenous cultures, and got to learn about a few different realities, even if remotely. Together we've been planning how to help communities and wrote a few communication/information related projects seeking funding.

## My current understanding of reality

![aldeias_br.gif](&hjNB6+UDQ4zUtkFpISQMNMXtNlLKaMdA76ynmKNOYVA=.sha256)
*Map with known indigenous communities and "official" territories within "brazilian" territory*

The yellow pins in the map above are a few of the known indigenous villages in brazilian territory, and the white areas are the "official", government sanctioned, territories. The relation between the presence of indigenous cultures and forest conservation is obvious.

The deeper within the forest villages are, the less likely they are to have communication, and most probable of being molested by loggers, miners and narcotic traffickers. Basic communication is a matter of survival for many. And besides only survival they **must** have the ability to speak to the outside world for themselves without depending on the state or NGOs (or myself for that matter) to speak for them. I personally also believe that giving them voice could inspire many out there who can't seem to grasp that there are alternatives to self-destructive systems.

Access to information is also crucial as most villages aren't 100% autonomous anymore, so they need to interact with the market for some basics needs. They also make use of a wide variety of modern tools, which obviously break. Many times they're able to hack the tools and make use of them in some way, but many other times the tools become obsolete, so access to technical knowledge is fundamental.

## Secure, low cost, low energy communication and information technologies

There have been amazing projects that have connected remote forest areas, such as [Rhizomatica's Hermes](https://www.rhizomatica.org/hermes/) which uses HF radio. But HF equipment is still way too expensive, energy consuming (many villages don't have electricity) and requires a ham-radio license, which makes it not scale at the pace which is [urgently](%4nTDVO9ZxZGFYNCGYnnIBLUmc3DpBBKZskbygRuwhos=.sha256) needed.

I've been really into #electronics lately, and been obsessed with the idea of building non-corporate communication/information devices. So I've been investigating #lora a lot, and how it's perfect for such remote cases, at least as a first option until high-bandwidth communication reaches them.

A single-board computer loaded with applications such as #manyverse, #ahau, #mapeo and #kolibri would serve the purpose of giving access to at least some pre-loaded information, and delay-tolerant communication of large files.

Combined these technologies offer a cheap, low energy, low tech barrier initial solution that might scale.

## My Dream

![nodes_rionegro.jpg](&2c/C6npkznEJV4G9bZl43oo22teNGm/uZUcCDsKCGfE=.sha256)

I've been using [this tool](https://link.ui.com) to locate hills near important Amazon rivers, which are likely to also have communities in the need of communication/information tech. Still need to do lots of experimentation, but I think that such LoRa mesh would be feasible.

I can't stop dreaming on going on an expedition *a la* [Schultes](https://www.amazonteam.org/maps/schultes/en/) (lol) in order to connect peoples of the Earth not only to the world, but most specially to connect them with each other and other originary cultures around the world. That's where I see the potential for great change.

I'll keep on experimenting, just wanted to throw this here, as SSB has a magic that makes dreams come true ;)
